abstracts.cdata!:
The area related to the Mine Township
            Services Project is located in the Copperbelt Province,
            influenced by the flow regime of the upper Kafue River
            basin, where human interventions, in addition to geophysical
            characteristics, and a number of water usage and management
            activities, have had an adverse environmental impact on the
            area, particularly as it regards water and air pollution,
            solid waste generation, and, deforestation. Since the
            construction of the project poses further environmental
            risks on the area, the Environmental Assessment (EA)
            presents mitigating measures, addressing in particular
            sewage effluent issues, which have permanently changed the
            ecological system of streams flowing into the Kafue River.
            Measures re-enforce the need to assure that the management
            contract include raw water quantity, and quality monitoring,
            which includes waste water management, i.e., quality of
            treated effluents, and equipment investments. Furthermore,
            the need for a training component for water supply, and
            sanitation systems' operators is addressed, as well as
            the risk of cross contamination of water supply,
            recommending separation of workers dealing with clean water,
            from those with residual waters, and, a solid waste
            management component is recommended, outlining a number of
            sub-component activities. Involuntary resettlement has been
            identified as a direct consequence of the project.
